name: Adetola Adedoyin
professionalSummary: Results-driven DevOps and Cloud Infrastructure Engineer trainee with hands-on experience deploying and managing scalable cloud infrastructure using AWS, Terraform, and containerization tools like Docker and Kubernetes. Skilled in building CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions, automating infrastructure provisioning, and ensuring system reliability with monitoring and scripting. Proven ability to apply Infrastructure as Code (IaC), troubleshoot complex systems, and improve operational workflows. Committed to continuous learning and capable of thriving in fast-paced, production-level environments.

experience.role: DevOps and Cloud Infrastructure Engineer Trainee
responsibilities: Designed and deployed a fully automated multi-tier web application on AWS using EC2, VPC, subnets, security groups, and Terraform.
Built and containerized a Spring Boot application using Docker, and automated deployment with GitHub Actions.
Configured monitoring tools and scripts to track system logs and uptime on virtual machines.
Installed and managed Linux virtual machines on physical servers, ensuring proper configuration and network access.
Practiced IAM role and policy setup, SSM configuration, and CI/CD integration for seamless deployment to production-like environments.
Provided technical support by diagnosing and resolving hardware related issues to ensure optimal system performance and minimal downtime.

experience.role: Head of Department / Tech Support Specialist
responsibilities: Streamlined ICT processes by automating administrative workflows and digital documentation.
Supported 200+ users by managing system-level tasks, software installations, and basic network troubleshooting.
Coordinated departmental resources and optimized technical operations during critical academic cycles.
